statements.select:
SELECT ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY aa.ID) AS RowNo , aa.ID , aa.CreatedOn , aa.CreatedBy , aa.CreatedByName , aa.UpdatedOn , aa.UpdatedBy , aa.UpdatedByName , aa.CalDate , aa.CalYear , aa.CalMonth , aa.CalDay , aa.Quarter , aa.DayOfWeek , aa.DayOfYear , aa.WeekOfMonth , aa.WeekOfYear , isnull(aa.HolidayYn,'N') as HolidayYn , aa.Description , case aa.DayOfWeek when 1 then '일' when 2 then '월' when 3 then '화' when 4 then '수' when 5 then '목' when 6 then '금' when 7 then '토' end as DayOfWeekName FROM dbo.TCalendar aa with (nolock) WHERE 1=1
AND aa.CalYear = #CalYear#
ORDER BY RowNo
SELECT * FROM dbo.TCalendar aa WITH (NOLOCK) WHERE ID=#ID#
SELECT * FROM dbo.TCalendar aa WITH (NOLOCK) WHERE aa.CalDate = #CalDate#
statements.insert:
INSERT INTO dbo.TCalendar ( CreatedOn, CreatedBy, CreatedByName, CalDate, CalYear, CalMonth, CalDay, Quarter, DayOfWeek, DayOfYear, WeekOfMonth, WeekOfYear, HolidayYn, Description ) VALUES ( GetDate(), #CreatedBy#, #CreatedByName#, #CalDate#, #CalYear#, #CalMonth#, #CalDay#, #Quarter#, #DayOfWeek#, #DayOfYear#, #WeekOfMonth#, #WeekOfYear#, #HolidayYn#, #Description# )
SELECT @@IDENTITY AS ID
statements.update: UPDATE dbo.TCalendar SET WeekOfMonth = #WeekOfMonth# , HolidayYn = #HolidayYn# , Description = #Description# , UpdatedOn = GETDATE() , UpdatedBy = #UpdatedBy# , UpdatedByName = #UpdatedByName# WHERE ID = #ID#
